blackout.translation[0].definitions[0].d: a period of darkness caused by a failure of the electricity supply
blackout.translation[0].definitions[1].d: a situation in which particular pieces of news or information are not allowed to be reported
blackout.translation[0].definitions[1].e: As the crisis worsened, the authorities imposed a news blackout.
blackout.translation[0].definitions[2].d: a period during a war when all the lights in a town or city must be turned off
blackout.translation[0].definitions[3].d: if someone has a blackout, they suddenly become unconscious
